text: Castanopsis clemensii is a tree in the family Fagaceae. It is named for the American chaplain and plant collector Joseph Clemens. ==Description== Castanopsis clemensii grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The yellowish white bark is smooth or cracked or lenticellate. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its ellipsoid nuts measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Castanopsis clemensii is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is lower montane forests up to altitude. ==References== clemensii Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1968
title: Castanopsis clemensii
